excerpt: Preserved 16th-century fort featuring many different architectural styles, with guided tours.
detail_description: Junagarh Fort, a stunning 16th-century marvel located in Bikaner, is a must-visit for history enthusiasts and architecture lovers alike. This impressive fort showcases an eclectic mix of architectural styles that reflect the rich cultural heritage of the region. As you explore its grand halls and intricate designs, guided tours offer fascinating insights into its storied past.
name: Junagarh Fort
address: Bikaner Fort, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Lalgarh Palace Garden is a stunning palace and heritage hotel located in Bikaner, Rajasthan. Built between 1902 and 1926 for Sir Ganga Singh, Maharaja of Bikaner, the palace is a magnificent example of Indo-Saracenic architecture. Made of red sandstone with intricate latticework, it seamlessly blends Mughal, Rajputana, and European styles.
name: Lalgarh Palace Garden
address: D/68, Samta Nagar, Bikaner, Beechhwal Rural, Rajasthan 334001, India

excerpt: Center for various camel breeds, with desert treks, a museum & a dairy serving camel milk ice cream.
detail_description: The ICAR-National Research Centre on Camel, nestled in the heart of Bikaner, Rajasthan, is a remarkable hub dedicated to the study and enhancement of camel husbandry. This innovative center not only focuses on breeding and health management but also plays a vital role in supporting local communities that rely on these magnificent animals for their livelihoods.
name: ICAR-National Research Centre on Camel
address: Shiv bari Jorbeer, Jodhpur Bypass, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

excerpt: Prominent 15th-century temple known for its ornate architecture, stone carvings & wall paintings.
detail_description: The Seth Bhandashah Jain Temple, a stunning gem from the 15th century, stands out as one of Bikaner's most exquisite Jain temples. Renowned for its intricate architecture and vibrant wall paintings, this temple showcases a harmonious blend of white marble and red sandstone that radiates elegance. Inside, visitors are greeted by beautifully carved pillars adorned with floral motifs and captivating depictions of the lives of the 24 tirthankars—great teachers in Jainism.
name: Seth Bhandashah Jain Temple
address: 2832+W82, Old Bikaner, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Rampuria Haveli is a renowned cluster of aristocratic homes in Bikaner, known for its exquisite architecture and historical significance. Constructed in the 15th century by the affluent Rampuria merchant family, these havelis are made of striking Dulmera red sandstone and showcase a blend of Mughal, Victorian, and Rajputana architectural styles.
name: Rampuria Haveli
address: Rampuria Havellis, Joshiwara, Old Bikaner, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

excerpt: Museum tracing Bikaner's cultural history with exhibits ranging from art to royal fashions & armor.
detail_description: Prachina Museum, located within the Junagarh Fort in Bikaner, was established to showcase the rich cultural heritage of the region. It features a diverse collection including royal attire, traditional fabrics, and accessories. The museum also houses family portraits and artifacts reflecting the influence of Western culture over time. Visitors can explore exhibits ranging from art to royal fashion and armor, offering a glimpse into Bikaner's historical opulence and craftsmanship.
name: Prachina Museum
address: Junagarh Fort, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Shri Laxminath Temple, situated in the heart of Bikaner, Rajasthan, is a magnificent Hindu shrine dedicated to Lord Laxminath, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. Constructed by the Bikaneri Maharajas in the 16th century, this temple boasts imposing architecture adorned with intricate stone carvings and vibrant frescoes that showcase a blend of Rajasthani and Mughal styles.
name: Shri Laxminath Temple
address: Vaidya Mangaram Colony, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334004, India

detail_description: The Ganga State Museum, established by Maharaja Ganga Singh in 1937, is a prominent attraction in Bikaner. It showcases artifacts of historical significance predating the Harappan civilization, including paintings, pottery, and weaponry used by the Rajputs. The museum offers insights into the history of Bikaner and the royal families through displays of photos, utensils, and armory.
name: Ganga State Museum
address: 288H+VCM, Museum Rd, Civil Lines, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Sri Sadul Museum, located within the grand Lallgarh Palace in Bikaner, offers a unique and intimate experience that transports visitors into the world of genteel luxury. Unlike typical museums, this early 20th century suite showcases limited yet precious memorabilia belonging to Bikaneri Maharajas such as paintings, vintage cars, and quirky travel souvenirs.
name: Sri Sadul Museum
address: 28RJ+H2G, Samta Nagar, Bikaner, Beechhwal Rural, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: The Laleshwar Mahadev Mandir, also known as the Shiv Bari Temple, is a revered Hindu shrine in Bikaner, Rajasthan. Built in the 19th century by Maharaja Doongar Singhji, this temple showcases impressive Rajput architecture with intricately sculpted stone carvings. The sanctum houses a black marble lingam and is dedicated to Lord Shiva.
name: Laleshwar Mahadev Mandir , Shiv Bari Temple, Bikaner
address: 2923+8RX, Ambedkar Colony, Bikaner, Shivbari Rural, Rajasthan 334003, India

detail_description: Kote Gate is a captivating landmark that serves as the main entrance to Bikaner, beautifully bridging the old and new parts of the city. This historic gate not only boasts architectural charm but also offers an exciting shopping experience for visitors. As you stroll through Kote Gate, you'll find yourself immersed in a vibrant marketplace filled with traditional clothing, handicrafts, and unique local artifacts. The lively atmosphere is enhanced by colorful stalls showcasing everything from Khadi items to camel hide products.
name: Kote Gate
address: Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: The Ganga Golden Jubilee Club, also known as the Bikaner Museum, was established in 1937 to commemorate Maharaja Ganga Singh's Golden Jubilee celebrations. Initially located near Lalgarh Palace and later moved to a new building in Civil Lines, this museum is now managed by the Government of Rajasthan. It features an extensive collection of artifacts from Bikaner's history, including archaeological items from the Harappa and early Gupta periods.
name: Ganga Golden Jubilee Club
address: 28HG+JCW, Mehron Ka Bas, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Karni Mata Temple, located in Deshnok, about 30 kilometers from Bikaner, is a renowned Hindu temple dedicated to Karni Mata. Legend has it that when Karni Mata's son died, she pleaded with the gods for his life and was granted the wish with the condition that her family members would be reincarnated as rats.
name: Karni Mata Temple
address: X7MV+CMJ, Old Ln, Gangashahar, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334401, India

detail_description: Bikaji Ki Tekri, a historic site in Bikaner, was built around 500 years ago by Rao Bika using red sandstone. This fort is known for its interconnected rooms and royal chhattris that commemorate the rulers of Bikaner. Located just outside the city near the old palace, it offers insights into the customs and beliefs of that time. It has been used as a residence by Rao Bika and later kings and is now under conservation.
name: Bikaji Ki Tekri
address: 2823+W4V, Hammalon Ki Bari, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Lalgarh Palace is a stunning red sandstone palace that exudes luxury and opulence. The architectural design seamlessly combines Mughal, Rajputana, and European styles, creating a truly magnificent structure. It offers visitors an opportunity to immerse themselves in the grandeur of its design and experience the beauty of its surroundings.
name: Lalgarh Palace
address: 28RJ+H2G, Samta Nagar, Bikaner, Beechhwal Rural, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: The Jain Temple in Bikaner, Rajasthan is a stunning 16th-century complex dedicated to the 23rd Tirthankar Parshvanathji. It is one of the important shrines in Bikaner, along with other temples like Lakshminathji, Ratan Biharji, Shiv Bari, and Nagnechiji temple.
name: Jain Temple
address: Chhajeron Ka Mohalla, Joshiwara, Old Bikaner, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Embark on a captivating adventure with a Camel Safari, an excellent choice for those seeking an unforgettable experience. Located in the charming city of Bikaner, this activity is a must-visit. The service provided is exceptional and ensures a delightful time for you and your loved ones. With its picturesque surroundings and top-notch service, it's an ideal option for camel riding enthusiasts looking to create lasting memories.
name: Camel safari
address: 2898+Q52, Gardan cafe, Kote Gate, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334022, India

detail_description: The Rajasthan State Archive Department (Directorate) in Bikaner, Rajasthan, is a treasure trove of historical documents from the 'Raja-Maharaja' era. With over 1 crore documents already scanned and 80 lacs uploaded on their website, it's the only digitized state archive gallery in India. The collection includes administrative records from the Mughal period and those created during the administration of the Princely states of Rajasthan.
name: Rajasthan State Archive Department (Directorate)
address: Transport Nagar, Hanuman Hatha, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

excerpt: Bikaner is a city in the north Indian state of Rajasthan, east of the border with Pakistan. It's surrounded by the Thar Desert. The city is known for the 16th-century Junagarh Fort, a huge complex of ornate buildings and halls. Within the fort, the Prachina Museum displays traditional textiles and royal portraits. Nearby, the Karni Mata Temple is home to many rats considered sacred by Hindu devotees.
detail_description: Bikaner, a city in the north Indian state of Rajasthan, is surrounded by the Thar Desert and known for its 16th-century Junagarh Fort and Prachina Museum displaying traditional textiles and royal portraits. The Karni Mata Temple nearby is home to sacred rats. This cultural paradise boasts magnificent architecture, art, and a vibrant atmosphere filled with color and festivity.
name: Bikaner
address: Rajasthan, India

detail_description: Public Park in Bikaner is a delightful spot that offers a perfect blend of relaxation and recreation for families, friends, and solo visitors alike. Ideal for morning walks or evening hangouts, this park features a walking track surrounded by lush greenery. Children can enjoy the slides and swings while adults unwind by the charming water fountain that comes alive at night. Although it has faced some challenges with maintenance over time—particularly concerning the selfie point—the overall atmosphere remains inviting.
name: Public Park
address: 28CC+468, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Ratan Bihari Temple in Bikaner, Rajasthan was originally built by Maharaja Ratan Singh Ji at the urging of his queen, a devout follower of Lord Krishna. Dedicated to Lord Vishnu and Lord Krishna, this temple is a symbol of love and reverence. It holds significance in Bikaner's tourism scene.
name: Ratan Bihari Temple
address: 2898+R5W, KEM Rd, Chaukhunti Mohalla, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Located 15 km from Bikaner, the Jorbeer Conservation Reserve is a unique vulture sanctuary and acts as a dumping ground for camel and livestock carcasses. It's home to thousands of vultures, kites, and pigeons that play an important role in the ecosystem. The reserve is mainly for raptors, offering the opportunity to see various types of eagles and vultures.
name: Jorbeer Conservation Reserve
address: near NRCC, Bikaner, Jorbeer Rural, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Usta art, also known as Naqqashi and Manoti art, is a traditional form of painting practiced by Usta artisans from Bikaner. Originating in Persia and later coming to India, this art form involves intricate gold painting on camel skin. It is highly regarded in the world of art for its delicate and detailed work. Visitors can experience the rich cultural heritage and craftsmanship by visiting workshops like Mr.
name: Usta art
address: Janta Pyau Shreeramsar Road Usta Colony BKN, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: When it comes to shopping in Bikaner, the 99 Shopping Gallery stands out as a vibrant hub offering a wide array of colorful and diverse shopping opportunities. Renowned for its exquisite Kundan jewelry, this place is a treasure trove for those seeking unique and authentic pieces. Visitors praise the gallery for its extensive range of products, with many items available at an affordable price point of just 99 rupees.
name: 99 Shopping Gallery
address: Inside Kotgate Near Vishawjyoti/ Vijay Shopping Mall, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Station Rd in Bikaner serves as a crucial link between the city's railway station and its vibrant center. The bustling thoroughfare is flanked by various establishments such as shops, hotels, and eateries, offering convenience and a plethora of services to visitors. It provides an energetic entry point for travelers to delve into the historical and cultural riches of Bikaner.
name: Station Rd
address: Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Chhotu Motu Joshi Sweet Shop & Restaurant is a delightful destination for couples looking to satisfy their sweet cravings while enjoying the rich culinary traditions of Rajasthan. This charming eatery offers an impressive selection of delectable sweets and savory snacks, from the soft and syrupy Rasgullas to the crispy, golden Jalebis that are sure to tantalize your taste buds.
name: Chhotu Motu Joshi
address: Station Rd, Kote Gate, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Bikaner Miniature Arts is a must-visit destination for art enthusiasts. The workshop is run by Mahaveer Swami, an award-winning miniature painting artist known for his exceptional skills and unique creations. Visitors can witness the creation of masterpieces on silk canvas and semi-ivory base, showcasing a blend of Indian and European art styles. Mahaveer Swami holds a Guinness World Record in the field of miniature arts, adding to the allure of this place.
name: Bikaner Miniature Arts
address: Kirti Stambh, On The, Municipal Rd, opposite Muthoot Fincorp Gold Loan, Citcle, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Junagarh Palace And Museum in Bikaner is an impressive fortress that has never been conquered. Built in 1588 AD, it features stunning palaces made of red sandstone and marble, with beautiful courtyards, balconies, and windows. The palace showcases unique rooms like a viewing room offering panoramic views of the fort, a gold-plated meeting area for the Maharaja, and a mirror room.
name: Junagarh Palace And Museum Bikaner
address: 28C9+PGV, Bikaner Fort, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Karni Mata Temple, located in the Vijaybhawan campus of Bikaner, is a renowned Hindu temple with a fascinating and unusual feature - it's home to over 20,000 rats. Despite this peculiarity, the temple is a popular tourist attraction where devotees offer food to the resident rats. The ancient temple was built by Maharaja Shri Ganga Singh ji and is known for its awesome architecture and serene surroundings.
name: Karni Mata Temple vijaybhawan
address: Vijay Bhawan Palace, Veterinary University Rd, Samta Nagar, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

name: Bikaner Tour and Travels
address: Nagar Nigam Road, near Soor Sagar Lake, opp. Mata Ji Temple, Mehron Ka Bas, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Bikaner Travels is a well-regarded bus service that operates between Bikaner and Jaipur. Passengers have praised the comfortable seating, cleanliness, and amenities provided on the buses. The drivers are described as sensible and good, providing a safe and secure journey. The service is known for its punctuality, with a single rest point during the journey. Some passengers have suggested providing quilts for added comfort during colder mornings.
name: Bikaner Travels
address: Panchsati Circle, Sadul Ganj, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Laxmi Niwas, located near Junagarh fort, is a luxurious palace built by Maharaja Ganga Singh in 1902. The architecture is a fusion of British, Mughal, and Hindu styles, featuring latticed windows, elegant columns, and lotus embossed domes. This royal abode offers a glimpse into the opulent lifestyle of Bikaner royalty from the past.
name: Laxmi niwas
address: 2856+9QX, GS Road, near bhawani hotel, opposite pink city motors, Chhipon Ka Mohalla, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Karni Mata Mandir is a grand abode dedicated to Karni Mata, known for the legend of her plea to Goddess Durga after the God of death refused to restore her son's life. As a result, all her family members were reincarnated as rats. Located near Modi Maidan in Kheteshwar Basti, Gangashahar, this temple is now home to a reduced number of holy rats compared to earlier times.
name: karni mata mandir
address: X7WW+RF8, श्री महादेव स्वीट्स एंड केटर्स के पास, Gangashahar, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: Nestled along the vibrant Bikaji Cir Rd, you'll discover a treasure trove of unique shopping experiences. This bustling area is home to an array of delightful finds, from custom engraved silver toe rings and exquisite polki-studded wedding chudas to charming patchwork potlis. As you explore this lively lane, be sure to indulge in the iconic crunch biscuit packs that Bikaji is renowned for—perfect souvenirs to take with you on your travels!
name: Bikaji Cir Rd
address: PBM Hospital, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

detail_description: The Royal Cenotaphs is a historically significant site that was once a fort, attacked and destroyed by Muslim invaders eight centuries ago. Today, it has been transformed into a park featuring remnants of the destroyed structures. The park also includes a museum showcasing the art, culture, and traditions of this place. One notable feature is the tall stone buildings that exhibit remarkable architectural prowess from 800 years ago.
name: Royal Cenotaphs
address: 923P+23F, Mandore, Jodhpur, Rajasthan 342007, India

name: Rampuria Havelli
address: Joshiwara, Mohalla, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India

name: Rukhsar Nursery
address: 27FQ+443, Old Gajner Rd, Jawahar Nagar, Gajner, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334004, India

detail_description: The Bikaner Heritage Walk offers a captivating experience with its stunning architecture that is best enjoyed during a leisurely stroll in the morning or evening. The area boasts remarkable architectural marvels that are sure to leave visitors in awe, making it an amazing and beautiful place to explore.
name: Bikaner Heritage Walk
address: 2863+VXX, Joshiwara, Sunaron Ka Mohalla, Bikaner, Rajasthan 334001, India
